In a Residence 1A District, the following regulations
shall apply.

No building shall be erected, altered or used
and no lot or premises shall be used except for one or more of the
purposes permitted in a Residence A District.

The maximum height of any building or any part
thereof shall be 28 feet in the case of a gable, hip or gambrel roof,
or 25 feet in the case of all other roofs, or 2 1/2 stories,
whichever is less. No principal building shall be raised and no principal
building or any part thereof shall be erected or altered which has
a height of less than one story or 20 feet, whichever is less.

No building shall hereafter be erected or altered
on a lot of less area than one acre (43,560 square feet), nor shall
a building hereafter be erected or altered unless such lot shall have
a frontage of not less than 150 feet on at least one street, except
that in the case of a corner lot, such lot shall have a frontage of
not less than 150 feet on at least two streets. Notwithstanding the
above, when the frontage of a lot coincides with the circumference
of a turnaround at the end of a permanent dead-end street, such lot
shall have a frontage of not less than 100 feet on such turnaround.

Every building hereafter erected or altered
shall have a rear yard of a minimum depth of 40 feet.

No building shall be hereafter erected or altered
which shall have its front wall nearer to the street line than 60
feet. In case of a corner lot, a front yard shall be required on each
street upon which the lot abuts. The interior angles formed by the
intersection of the lot's lines with the street line shall not be
less than 75° for the entire distance from the street lines to
the front yard setback line or lines.

Two side yards shall be provided on every lot.
Neither side yard shall be less than 30 feet.

Where property borders upon tidewater or where
interior lots have a right-of-way to the waterfront and rights of
users permitting the same, there may be constructed adjacent to and
abutting the waterline on the property, a dock, pergola, summerhouse,
boathouse or bathhouse not designed nor to be used for the storage
of automobiles or the keeping of horses or for any other purpose than
to facilitate the uses of the waterfront. None of such building may
be over two stories in height. No such accessory building or docks
as may be erected shall be used for any public use or for any other
use not permitted specifically under this section. In the case of
a structure permitted by this section, there shall be two side yards,
one on each side of the structure, and such shall be at least 15%
of the width of the lot. Neither side yard shall be less than 11 1/4
feet. No principal building and no accessory building, except as noted
above, shall be constructed upon any lot fronting or bordering upon
water at a distance less than 50 feet, measured from any part of such
building to the high-water mark.

No main dwelling shall be erected unless it
has habitable floor area of at least 2,400 square feet.

The maximum building height to front yard setback
ratio shall be 0.350.

The maximum building height to side yard setback
ratio shall be 0.700.
